Lack enough support: The claim that "The Russians didn’t wear uniforms when they came in" to Ukraine lacks sufficient support as there is evidence of troops under Russian command and in unmarked uniforms firing weapons at the Russian-occupied Belbek airbase in Crimea.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there were troops in unmarked uniforms who were identified as Russian soldiers by residents and news outlets.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which the Russians did not wear uniforms, as there is evidence of troops wearing unmarked uniforms.
Falters at times: The claim falters in accurately representing the situation in Ukraine, as there is evidence of Russian troops in unmarked uniforms present in the country.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the presence of troops in unmarked uniforms, such as covert operations or attempts to avoid identification.
